thread.title: Speedy WR from South Florida gets UGA offer - 247Sports
thread.title_full: Speedy WR from South Florida gets UGA offer - 247Sports

title: Speedy WR from South Florida gets UGA offer - 247Sports
text:
Speedy WR from South Florida gets UGA offer Georgia has extended an offer to one of the most explosive prospects in the country. Slot to Georgia Links 
Georgia has extended an offer to an out-of-state prospect from a school where it has gotten top prospects before. American Heritage (Ft. Lauderdale, Fla.) wide receiver Anthony Schwartz tweeted Saturday that the Bulldogs had extended a tender, making them the 25th team to do so. 
The Bulldogs have had some success at American Heritage in the past, signing Sony Michel and Isaiah McKenzie out of there in the 2014 class. Not a member? Try a seven-day FREE trial to VIP access to Dawgs247! 
The 6-foot, 172-pound pass catcher is one of the most explosive players in the country. He has been clocked at under 4.4 seconds in the 40-yard dash and averaged 26 yards per touch during his junior season. He set a school record on Saturday at the Kowboy Invitational with a time of 10.37 seconds in the 100 meters. Crystal Ball outlook for the nationâ€™s top recruits Start SlideShow 
Schwartz is ranked as the 411th overall prospect and as the 71st wide receiver in the nation according to the industry-generated 247Sports Composite. He's also seen as the 65th overall prospect in Florida. There are no predictions in his 247Sports Crystal Ball at this time but Florida and Miami are considered the front runners at this time. Author
